00019 #ifndef TLM_UTILS_MULTI_PASSTHROUGH_TARGET_SOCKET_H_INCLUDED_
00020 #define TLM_UTILS_MULTI_PASSTHROUGH_TARGET_SOCKET_H_INCLUDED_
00021 
00022 #include "tlm_utils/multi_socket_bases.h"
00023 
00024 namespace tlm_utils {
00025 
00026 /*
00027 This class implements a trivial multi target socket.
00028 The triviality refers to the fact that the socket does not
00029 do blocking to non-blocking or non-blocking to blocking conversions.
00030 
00031 It allows to connect multiple initiators to this socket.
00032 The user has to register callbacks for the fw interface methods
00033 he likes to use. The callbacks are basically equal to the fw interface
00034 methods but carry an additional integer that indicates to which
00035 index of this socket the calling initiator is connected.
00036 */
00037 template <typename MODULE,
00038           unsigned int BUSWIDTH = 32,
00039           typename TYPES = tlm::tlm_base_protocol_types,
00040           unsigned int N=0,
00041           sc_core::sc_port_policy POL = sc_core::SC_ONE_OR_MORE_BOUND>
00042 class multi_passthrough_target_socket
00043   : public multi_target_base< BUSWIDTH, TYPES, N, POL>
00044   , public multi_to_multi_bind_base<TYPES>
00045 {
00046 
00047 public:
00048 
00049   //typedefs
00050   //  tlm 2.0 types for nb_transport
00051   typedef typename TYPES::tlm_payload_type              transaction_type;
00052   typedef typename TYPES::tlm_phase_type                phase_type;
00053   typedef tlm::tlm_sync_enum                            sync_enum_type;
00054 
00055   //  typedefs to keep the fn ptr notations short
00056   typedef sync_enum_type (MODULE::*nb_cb)(int, transaction_type&, phase_type&, sc_core::sc_time&);
00057   typedef void (MODULE::*b_cb)(int, transaction_type&, sc_core::sc_time&);
00058   typedef unsigned int (MODULE::*dbg_cb)(int, transaction_type& txn);
00059   typedef bool (MODULE::*dmi_cb)(int, transaction_type& txn, tlm::tlm_dmi& dmi);
00060 
00061   typedef multi_target_base<BUSWIDTH, TYPES, N, POL> base_type;
00062 
00063   typedef typename base_type::base_initiator_socket_type base_initiator_socket_type;
00064 
00065   static const char* default_name()
00066     { return sc_core::sc_gen_unique_name("multi_passthrough_target_socket"); }
00067 
00068   //CTOR
00069   explicit multi_passthrough_target_socket(const char* name = default_name())
00070       : base_type(name)
00071       , m_hierarch_bind(0)
00072       , m_eoe_disabled(false)
00073       , m_export_callback_created(false)
00074   {
00075   }
00076 
00077   ~multi_passthrough_target_socket(){
00078     //clean up everything allocated by 'new'
00079     for (unsigned int i=0; i<m_binders.size(); i++) delete m_binders[i];
00080   }
00081 
00082   void check_export_binding()
00083   {
00084     //if our export hasn't been bound yet (due to a hierarch binding)
00085     //  we bind it now.
00086     //We do that here as the user of the target port HAS to bind at least on callback,
00087     //otherwise the socket was useless. Nevertheless, the target socket may still
00088     // stay unbound afterwards.
00089     if (!sc_core::sc_export<tlm::tlm_fw_transport_if<TYPES> >::get_interface())
00090     {
00091       // We bind to a callback_binder that will be used as the first interface
00092       // i.e. calls to the sc_export will have the same ID as calls from the first initator
00093       // socket bound
00094       callback_binder_fw<TYPES> * binder;
00095 
00096       if (m_binders.size() == 0)
00097       {
00098         binder = new callback_binder_fw<TYPES>(this, m_binders.size());
00099         m_binders.push_back(binder);
00100         m_export_callback_created = true;
00101       }
00102       else
00103       {
00104         binder = m_binders[0];
00105       }
00106 
00107       sc_core::sc_export<tlm::tlm_fw_transport_if<TYPES> >::bind(*binder);
00108     }
00109   }
00110 
00111   //register callback for nb transport of fw interface
00112   void register_nb_transport_fw(MODULE* mod,
00113                               nb_cb cb)
00114   {
00115     check_export_binding();
00116 
00117     //warn if there already is a callback
00118     if (m_nb_f.is_valid()){
00119       display_warning("NBTransport_bw callback already registered.");
00120       return;
00121     }
00122 
00123     //set the functor
00124     m_nb_f.set_function(mod, cb);
00125   }
00126 
00127   //register callback for b transport of fw interface
00128   void register_b_transport(MODULE* mod,
00129                               b_cb cb)
00130   {
00131     check_export_binding();
00132 
00133     //warn if there already is a callback
00134     if (m_b_f.is_valid()){
00135       display_warning("BTransport callback already registered.");
00136       return;
00137     }
00138 
00139     //set the functor
00140     m_b_f.set_function(mod, cb);
00141   }
00142 
00143   //register callback for debug transport of fw interface
00144   void register_transport_dbg(MODULE* mod,
00145                               dbg_cb cb)
00146   {
00147     check_export_binding();
00148 
00149     //warn if there already is a callback
00150     if (m_dbg_f.is_valid()){
00151       display_warning("DebugTransport callback already registered.");
00152       return;
00153     }
00154 
00155     //set the functor
00156     m_dbg_f.set_function(mod, cb);
00157   }
00158 
00159   //register callback for DMI of fw interface
00160   void register_get_direct_mem_ptr(MODULE* mod,
00161                                    dmi_cb cb)
00162   {
00163     check_export_binding();
00164 
00165     //warn if there already is a callback
00166     if (m_dmi_f.is_valid()){
00167       display_warning("DMI callback already registered.");
00168       return;
00169     }
00170 
00171     //set the functor
00172     m_dmi_f.set_function(mod, cb);
00173   }
00174 
00175 
00176   //Override virtual functions of the tlm_target_socket:
00177   // this function is called whenever an sc_port (as part of a init socket)
00178   //  wants to bind to the export of the underlying tlm_target_socket
00179   //At this time a callback binder is created an returned to the sc_port
00180   // of the init socket, so that it binds to the callback binder
00181   virtual tlm::tlm_fw_transport_if<TYPES>& get_base_interface()
00182   {
00183     //error if this socket is already bound hierarchically
00184     if (m_hierarch_bind) display_error("Socket already bound hierarchically.");
00185 
00186     if (m_export_callback_created) {
00187       // consume binder created from the callback registration
00188       m_export_callback_created = false;
00189     } else {
00190       m_binders.push_back(new callback_binder_fw<TYPES>(this, m_binders.size()));
00191     }
00192 
00193     return *m_binders[m_binders.size()-1];
00194   }
00195 
00196   // const overload not allowed for multi-sockets
00197   virtual const tlm::tlm_fw_transport_if<TYPES>& get_base_interface() const
00198   {
00199     display_error("'get_base_interface() const' not allowed for multi-sockets.");
00200     return base_type::get_base_interface();
00201   }
00202 
00203   //just return the export of the underlying tlm_target_socket in case of a hierarchical bind
00204   virtual sc_core::sc_export<tlm::tlm_fw_transport_if<TYPES> >& get_base_export()
00205   {
00206     return *this;
00207   }
00208 
00209   //just return the export of the underlying tlm_target_socket in case of a hierarchical bind
00210   virtual const sc_core::sc_export<tlm::tlm_fw_transport_if<TYPES> >& get_base_export() const
00211   {
00212     return base_type::get_base_export();
00213   }
00214 
00215   //the standard end of elaboration callback
00216   void end_of_elaboration(){
00217     //'break' here if the socket was told not to do callback binding
00218     if (m_eoe_disabled) return;
00219 
00220     //get the callback binders and the multi binds of the top of the hierachical bind chain
00221     // NOTE: this could be the same socket if there is no hierachical bind
00222     std::vector<callback_binder_fw<TYPES>* >& binders=get_hierarch_bind()->get_binders();
00223     std::map<unsigned int, tlm::tlm_bw_transport_if<TYPES>*>&  multi_binds=get_hierarch_bind()->get_multi_binds();
00224 
00225     // complete binding only if there has been a real bind
00226     bool locally_unbound = (binders.size() == 1 && m_export_callback_created);
00227     // no call to get_base_interface has consumed the export - ignore
00228     if (locally_unbound && !m_hierarch_bind)
00229         return;
00230 
00231     // iterate over all binders
00232     for (unsigned int i=0; i<binders.size(); i++) {
00233       binders[i]->set_callbacks(m_nb_f, m_b_f, m_dmi_f, m_dbg_f); //set the callbacks for the binder
00234       if (multi_binds.find(i)!=multi_binds.end()) //check if this connection is multi-multi
00235         //if so remember the interface
00236         m_sockets.push_back(multi_binds[i]);
00237       else{ //if we are bound to a normal socket
00238         //get the calling port and try to cast it into a tlm socket base
00239         base_initiator_socket_type* test=dynamic_cast<base_initiator_socket_type*>(binders[i]->get_other_side());
00240         if (!test){display_error("Not bound to tlm_socket.");}
00241         m_sockets.push_back(&test->get_base_interface()); //remember the interface
00242       }
00243     }
00244   }
00245 
00246   //
00247   // Bind multi target socket to multi target socket (hierarchical bind)
00248   //
00249   virtual void bind(base_type& s)
00250   {
00251     //warn if already bound hierarchically
00252     if (m_eoe_disabled){
00253       display_warning("Socket already bound hierarchically. Bind attempt ignored.");
00254       return;
00255     }
00256 
00257     //disable our own end of elaboration call
00258     disable_cb_bind();
00259 
00260     //inform the bound target socket that it is bound hierarchically now
00261     s.set_hierarch_bind((base_type*)this);
00262     base_type::bind(s); //satisfy SystemC
00263   }
00264 
00265   //operator notation for hierarchical bind
00266   void operator() (base_type& s)
00267   {
00268     bind(s);
00269   }
00270 
00271   //get access to sub port
00272   tlm::tlm_bw_transport_if<TYPES>* operator[](int i){return m_sockets[i];}
00273 
00274   //get number of bound initiators
00275   // NOTE: this is only valid at end of elaboration!
00276   unsigned int size(){return get_hierarch_bind()->get_binders().size();}
00277 
00278 protected:
00279   using base_type::display_warning;
00280   using base_type::display_error;
00281 
00282   //implementation of base class interface
00283   base_type* get_hierarch_bind(){if (m_hierarch_bind) return m_hierarch_bind->get_hierarch_bind(); else return this;}
00284   std::map<unsigned int, tlm::tlm_bw_transport_if<TYPES>*>&  get_multi_binds(){return m_multi_binds;}
00285   void set_hierarch_bind(base_type* h){m_hierarch_bind=h;}
00286   tlm::tlm_fw_transport_if<TYPES>* get_last_binder(tlm::tlm_bw_transport_if<TYPES>* other){
00287     m_multi_binds[m_binders.size()-1]=other;
00288     return m_binders[m_binders.size()-1];
00289   }
00290 
00291   //map that stores to which index a multi init socket is connected
00292   // and the interface of the multi init socket
00293   std::map<unsigned int, tlm::tlm_bw_transport_if<TYPES>*> m_multi_binds;
00294 
00295   void disable_cb_bind(){ m_eoe_disabled=true;}
00296   std::vector<callback_binder_fw<TYPES>* >& get_binders(){return m_binders;}
00297   //vector of connected sockets
00298   std::vector<tlm::tlm_bw_transport_if<TYPES>*> m_sockets;
00299   //vector of binders that convert untagged interface into tagged interface
00300   std::vector<callback_binder_fw<TYPES>*> m_binders;
00301 
00302   base_type*  m_hierarch_bind; //pointer to hierarchical bound multi port
00303   bool m_eoe_disabled; //bool that disables callback bindings at end of elaboration
00304   bool m_export_callback_created; //bool that indicates that a binder has been created from a callback registration
00305 
00306   //callbacks as functors
00307   // (allows to pass the callback to another socket that does not know the type of the module that owns
00308   //  the callbacks)
00309   typename callback_binder_fw<TYPES>::nb_func_type    m_nb_f;
00310   typename callback_binder_fw<TYPES>::b_func_type     m_b_f;
00311   typename callback_binder_fw<TYPES>::debug_func_type m_dbg_f;
00312   typename callback_binder_fw<TYPES>::dmi_func_type   m_dmi_f;
00313 };
00314 
00315 template <typename MODULE,
00316           unsigned int BUSWIDTH = 32,
00317           typename TYPES = tlm::tlm_base_protocol_types,
00318           unsigned int N=0>
00319 class multi_passthrough_target_socket_optional
00320   : public multi_passthrough_target_socket<MODULE,BUSWIDTH,TYPES,N,sc_core::SC_ZERO_OR_MORE_BOUND>
00321 {
00322   typedef multi_passthrough_target_socket<MODULE,BUSWIDTH,TYPES,N,sc_core::SC_ZERO_OR_MORE_BOUND> socket_b;
00323 public:
00324   multi_passthrough_target_socket_optional() : socket_b() {}
00325   explicit multi_passthrough_target_socket_optional(const char* name) : socket_b(name) {}
00326 };
00327 
00328 } // namespace tlm_utils
